componentInstanceProperties.name: IntroText
componentInstanceProperties.value: Disrupting the Wine Industry, One Glass at a Time

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Key Investment Highlights

  • Forecasting Profitability in FY26: With 3 primary markets: Direct to consumer, domestic wholesale and expert, A Glass of® forecasts revenue (incl postage) of $650K in FY24 increasing to 7.65 million in FY26 and becoming profitable, at 56% gross margin.
  • Massive Wine Market: Australian wine market revenue was approx. US$8.5 billion in 2023 at a CAGR of 4.42% (2023-2028).* The global wine market is projected to grow from $340.23 billion in 2021 to $456.76 billion in 2028 at a CAGR of 4.30% (2021-2028).**
  • Highly Experienced Leadership: Founder and CEO, Paul Taylor, has over 25 years of experience in brand development and is a former Creative Director/Partner at M&C SAATCHI. He has a highly experienced team including former beverage industry executive Peter Sinclair, and industry-leading Sommelier-in-Residence Gabrielle Webster. Former Virgin Money CEO David Wakeley is also involved as an advisor.
  • Traction & Growth to Date: Previous sommelier ranges have sold out (75,000 pouches), 62% repurchase rate, with increasing average spend (AOV), trademarked IP and sustainable manufacturing process.
  • High-end Customers: Hyatt Regency, Marriott Hotels, FIVE Palm Jumeirah in Dubai through distribution partner African & Eastern, plus Unyoked, Shorty's Liquor (part of Endeavour Group) and leading boutique hotels Crystalbrook Group of Hotels, Ace Hotel, Hyatt Centric, The Bower Bryon Bay, AC Marriott, The Brunswick, The Constance, Lancemore Werribee Park Mansion, QT Bondi.

*sources: Statistica and Fortune Business Insights

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Overview

Key Investor Highlights:

  • Customer-centric wine solution with proven traction.
  • Forecasting $21.6m revenue within 5 years.
  • Funding to meet rapid growth across B2C, B2B & Export markets; 3 tonnes of wine shipped to Dubai in Nov 2023.
  • Next routes to market; Quick Service Restaurants (QSR), Airlines, Food delivery, Meal prep, Short Stay Accommodation, Events, Gifting & Subscription.

A Glass of® was created to fill a need that the wine industry wasn’t meeting, to cater for consumers who wanted to enjoy a glass of good wine without always having to open a bottle.

Unencumbered by industry conventions and using a customer-centric approach, the founders disrupted the wine category with beautifully-branded curated wines from premium Australian winemakers, in glass-size (well, slightly more generous than a glass), environmentally-friendly pouches.

Their products capitalise on a convergence of five emerging trends:

  • Wellness - a focus on improving health and wellbeing through portion control. Drink less, but better.
  • Sustainability - the pouches require less materials and less energy to make than glass, cans or plastic bottles.
  • Authenticity - the rise in craft beverages, wanting to know the provenance of products, and supporting local, independent winemakers
  • Convenience - single-serve and portable
  • Celebrity - the cult of the sommelier

Even better, A Glass of®’s approach has been a win for the industry as well with more exposure for independent winemakers after Covid, bushfires and tariffs have wreaked havoc on the industry and down-the-line brand loyalty from consumers.

With strong growth in revenue and new channels to market being opened up in ANZ and EMEA and B2C sales in Australia, the company is now ready to further build its business and scale.

A Glass of® is currently raising up to $1.25 million seed equity round and is inviting VentureCrowd investors to close this round out with a $500,000 allocation (with the board reserving the right to take oversubscriptions).

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
IntroText
componentInstanceProperties.value:
A Glass of® is offering investors up to 15,410 shares in the company at approx. $48.67 per share.

Open to wholesale and pre-approved investors, VentureCrowd has been allocated $500,000 to close out this
Seed round (with the board reserving the right to take oversubscriptions), and you can invest from $5000.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Problem & Opportunity

A Glass of® was created to fill a need that the wine industry wasn’t meeting, to cater for consumers who wanted to try high-end wines by the glass not by the very expensive bottle.

Unencumbered by industry conventions and using a customer-centric approach, the founders disrupted the wine category with beautifully branded curated wines in glass-size (well, slightly more than a glass), environmentally-friendly pouches, capitalising on a convergence of trends including the acceptance of innovative packaging, demand for sustainable packaging, the less-but-better-quality trend, the providence of maker, the support of local, and the rise of the Somm-as-Social Influencer.

Even better, A Glass of®’s approach has been a win for the industry as well with more exposure for winemakers leading to down-the-line bottle sales from consumers.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
The Solution

A Glass of® sells wine by the glass giving consumers more choice in how they consume high-end wines, that are usually only available by the bottle. The company’s wines are produced by the best independent winemakers in the country, curated by sommeliers from Australia’s leading restaurants and delivered in sustainable packaging.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value: Unfair Advantage

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
“Bags are better for the product...and for the planet too.”

— Financial Times London

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Intellectual Property and Manufacturing Process

The A Glass of® team spent 18 months in R&D to design their unique pouches with sustainability in mind but with a premium feel. They conduct lab tests every three months on their packaged wine, and currently, they can prove a shelf life of at least 12 months. Advances in packaging technology and manufacturing processes will extend the product’s shelf life. However, it should be noted that the product is ready to drink and is designed to be consumed and enjoyed immediately, not cellared.

Both winemakers and consumers love A Glass of®’s pouches. Pouch packaging is being adopted by high-end brands across a wide variety of sectors as consumers and producers become more aware of the lower environmental impact they represent.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Sustainability Mandate

A Glass of® stands by the idea that precycling (the energy & resources required to make a product in the first place) is just as important as recycling. Glass bottle production contributes 50% to a winemaker’s total carbon footprint.

Fewer materials and less energy are required to make A Glass of® pouches than glass, cans or plastic bottles. It takes 73% less energy, 94% less water and 82% less Co2 to produce a pouch over glass bottles of the equivalent size.

The packaging is lighter and more space efficient, saving on transport fuel costs.

While single-serve promotes responsible consumption. In the US alone, USD 1.5 Billion worth of wine is poured down the sink from half-consumed bottles.

The company’s manufacturing plant is solar-powered. It offsets carbon for deliveries and continues to reduce waste. A Glass of® set up a closed-loop recycling program for its trade customers and expanded its recycling capability with the purchase of an industrial shredder machine to assist with recycling pouches in-house. The company plans to create and market second-life products out of its pouches in the future.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
richTextValue
richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Addressable Market

Revenue in the Australian Wine market amounts to US$8,546.0m in 2023. The market is expected to grow annually by 4.42% (CAGR 2023-2028).*

The global wine market is projected to grow from $340.23 billion in 2021 to $456.76 billion in 2028 at a CAGR of 4.30% in the forecast period, 2021-2028.**

*sources: Statistica and Fortune Business Insights

The target market for A Glass of® is women, 30 to 45, segmented into three main audiences: discovers, convenience drinkers and portion controllers.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Traction

Domestic B2B
Selling to high-end hotels, signing up new elite boutique hotels, with increasing frequency and volume. Expanding into quick service restaurants (eg, Banana Blossom), gift hampers and office-delivered alcohol, and investigating retail partnerships. Further expansion opportunities exist with airlines, airport lounges, short-stay accommodation, pre-prep delivery meal operators, home delivery food operators and dark kitchens, as well as event organisers such as music and film festivals.

International Export B2E
First order already shipped to Dubai hotels, with the 2nd order coming. Expansion into Singapore & HK markets is also underway.

Domestic B2C
Previous Sommelier Ranges have sold out (75,000 pouches), 62% repurchase rate and increasing AOV.

Customers include Hyatt Regency, Marriott Hotels, Ace Hotel, FIVE Palm Jumeirah in Dubai through distribution partner African & Eastern. Locally, glamping company Unyoked and leading boutique hotels Crystalbrook Byron Bay, The Bower Bryon Bay, AC Marriott, Hyatt Centric, The Brunswick, The Constance, Lancemore Werribee Park Mansion, & QT Hotel.

Three high-profile sommeliers have joined the company as curators including Gabby Webster (Bondi Icebergs) who is the new A Glass of® Sommelier-in-Residence, Alex Kirkwood (ex-Rockpool, now Shell House) and Jacq Turner (Chin Chin/Margaret), and the first Sommelier collection featured Young Winemaker of the Year, Will Gilbert.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Recent Developments

All raise #1 objectives achieved!

  • The team significantly cut costs and boosted efficiencies, resulting in improved product margins across all categories.
  • Their export strategy is gaining traction, with the appointment of industry veteran Peter Sinclair and partnerships with major distributors, marking our entry into the UAE market.
  • Negotiations are underway to supply Plaza Network lounges at Hong Kong Airport.
  • On the B2B front, they've expanded sales into high-end hotel minibars, secured partnerships with elite boutique hotels, and increased our presence in existing clients, including Hyatt and Ace Hotel.
  • For B2C, digital marketing has proven its mettle, driving a 20% increase in Average Order Value and a robust 62.8% returning customer rate.
  • Their product evolution includes a curated sommelier list (launched September 2023), a redesigned pouch for enhanced aesthetics, and refined procurement processes to reduce lead times and increase production yields.
  • Investments in production include a recycling initiative with a new shredder machine, equipment for sterile filtering, and the strategic shift of 3PL in-house for efficient order dispatch.
  • They’re streamlining the supply chain by exploring in-house printing capabilities for pouches.
  • The team has been bolstered by industry luminary Gabby Webster as Sommelier-in-Residence and a diverse group of first-round investors, enhancing their expertise and industry standing.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Growth Strategy

The company's growth focus is to drive export sales, secure domestic wholesale trade partnerships, and expand the direct-to-customer offering. In FY26 it is expected that the export business and the domestic B2B business will each contribute 47% of revenue, with the consumer business contributing the balance (6%).

Direct to consumer
The B2C channel plays a crucial role in providing a reputational halo for the brand. In financial terms, the numbers are low but growing steadily. What the company has built is a loyal community of wine drinkers that advocate on its behalf and this provides a strong base for future growth.

Domestic wholesale
A Glass of®’s leadership made a conscious decision to partner with the most innovative, design-led hotels in Australia. Hotels are notorious for stocking high-priced, average-at-best wines in their minibars.

The company’s brand aesthetic, excellent quality wine and sustainability credentials have made it the go-to wine of choice for contemporary hotel brands such as Ace Hotel, The Bower, Hyatt, Marriott, Crystalbrook and glamping leader, Unyoked. Its B2B expansion into retail will accelerate via partnerships with wholesale distributors such as Endeavour Group & Lagardere Duty-Free Group.

Export Sales
Export is a key opportunity for A Glass of®. The absence of the Australian Government’s WET alcohol tax (29% on wholesale sales) means the company can maintain a very good margin while trading at much higher volumes (selling pallets, not boxes of pouches). The company’s work in developing export markets is eligible for the Export Market Development Grant (EMDG), where 50% of its spend is reimbursed by the Australian Government.

The company has negotiated a distribution agreement with Shorty’s (part of the Endeavour Group) which will act as business development for corporate Australian clients.

Capital Required

The purpose of this second raise is to finance our expansion in these three market segments by:

  • Manufacturing higher volumes of pouch inventory at a lower cost to supply new customers.
  • Purchase of larger volumes of wine at a lower cost per litre to supply new orders.
  • Building out the core team to facilitate expansion in our three core markets.
  • Promotional spending to underpin the B2C sales and continue to provide halo brand credentials to support all market segments.
  • Upgrading sterilisation equipment to extend the shelf life of the product.
  • Purchasing a production-run laser printer. Pouch ‘best before’ print capability on the fly will enable the company to shorten the supply chain lead time by allowing it to mass purchase pouches at a lower cost. Currently, it orders pouches with pre-printed ‘best before’ dates.

Valuation Today & Valuation Uplift

The company’s current pre-money valuation is $6 million. The Board believes that this funding round will provide sufficient capital to support 12 months of operations over which time the forecast value of the organisation is projected to be at least double the $6 million pre-money value of the current raise.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Financials

The current financial year ‘23/24 remains an investment year with a projected EBITDA loss of just over $500k (representing a strong investment in scaling the growth drivers that have already been tested and proved out).

The next financial year ‘24/25 is projected to be break even. The financial years that follow are projected to be strong profit years, where we are able to fund the ongoing rapid growth of the business from the profits generated.

Growth expectations – forecast revenue of $650K in FY24 increasing to $7.65 million in FY26, at 55% gross margin.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Exit Strategy

There has already been investment interest in A Glass of® from a major beverage company and this organisation is a classic example of a potential future "natural owner" of the company. While the philosophic intent of the business is "scale and sale," the founder, board and management of the business are focused on achieving its growth targets over the next 5 years, at which point they would be open to potential exit options if they were in the best interests of shareholders.

It should be noted that there are several strategic decisions in their future that will impact the timing, nature and type of potential exit, in particular, the growth of the export markets for A Glass of® could open the opportunity for an exit to an overseas buyer.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Management Team

Paul Taylor, Founder & CEO
25 years of marketing experience as a global creative director, former partner M&C SAATCHI.

James Student, Engineer
Former Engineer (Biomedicine) and Agency Planner with 20+ years of technical and strategic problem-solving.

Peter Sinclair, Consultant Commercial
Former Marketing Director, CUB Aus and 10+ years UAE experience in beverage sales, marketing and distribution.

Liping Mao, Head of Procurement (Asia)
Responsible for sourcing and securing product and machinery and overseeing overseas product manufacturing and imports.

Gabrielle Webster, Sommelier-in-Residence
Industry-leading sommelier, responsible for maintaining wine selection excellence, liaising with winemakers and reputation management with the wine industry.

Luke Austin, Finance Director
Experienced CFO in the ITC Industry, including IBM, Lenovo & Huawei.

Rachel Kelly, Director
Highly experienced retail executive and advisor, previously Global CEO of T2, Head of Sales & Retail at Afterpay and Retail Director at Just Group.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Advisors

In addition, A Glass of curated a group of shareholders in raise #1 with diverse skill sets to propel the business forward. These people include:

Lee Hunter
Current GM of TikTok Australia, former Head of Marketing Strategy & Innovation at Google.

Adrian Bunter
Former PWC Director (Private Clients and Mergers & Acquisitions) with two decades of experience in debt/equity raisings, mergers and acquisitions, divestments of business and strategy development and execution. Holds a number of Non-Exec Director positions and is an Executive Committee Member of the Sydney Angels Inc.

Andrew McKeon
Former Global Creative Director, Apple. Global Customer Marketing Lead, Facebook.

Nik Witcombe
Former General Manager (Sales & Marketing) Pepsico, Mars, Unilever & 10 years at alcoholic drinks giant Diageo, UK & Australia.

Kensuke Chua (Singapore, Tokyo)
Former Global Head of Business Planning, Aesop. APEC Head of Finance, The Body Shop.

Damon Tudor
Current UrbnSurf Group CEO with 20 years of retail experience including key executive roles with AB Inbev and NRMA.

David Wakeley,Consultant Strategic Advisor/CFO
Former CEO Virgin Money, Non-executive Director of ParaFlare, UrbnSurf, Bank Australia and 10+ years in the start-up world with multiple exits delivered.

Chris Hemmings, Industry connector
Well-known in the hospitality and arts industries and delivers high-level introductions.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Why Invest Through VentureCrowd?

VentureCrowd is the leading digital investment platform for alternative assets. We find and fund the brightest and most innovative startups.

Our curation and due diligence are rigorous and our track record of success speaks for itself:

  • Only digital investment platform in Australia to have successfully delivered multiple exit returns to investors through equity crowdfunding

  • 74K+ members and counting

  • Over $312,000,000 in capital raised since inception

VentureCrowd is investor-led, which means we only list deals with secured professional external lead investors. Our investors then invest on the same economic terms as professional investors. If you invest in one of our deals you will receive equity or ownership in the company raising the capital. Not only might your investment come with lower fees and capital commitments, but it will also come with reduced deal complexity, and you’ll have access to alternative equity, property and credit opportunities on the same terms as professional lead investors.

Invest now

If you would prefer to speak to one of our team members about this offer, please:

  • Book a call or

  • call us on 1300 039 655

Please note, the Fund Manager reserves the right to vary or cancel the Offer, vary the amount raised under the Offer, vary or waive the Minimum Investment and close the Offer, without notice and without giving reasons.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Fees

Investors invest through a VentureCrowd Trust, which VentureCrowd manages as a single asset. We charge an annual management fee to investors, payable on exit and we only charge a performance fee where an exit delivers profit, thereby aligning ourselves with investor outcomes.

  • Contribution Fee: 1.1% This is the fee charged by the Trustee for the establishment of the Trust and the purchasing entity, structuring the overall investment and raising capital by way of issue of Units. Payable upon acceptance of your investment by the Trustee.
  • Management Fee: 1.65% per annum (charged on conversion or exit).
  • Performance Fee: 20% of the profit. We only charge a performance fee on conversion or exit.
  • Off-Market Transfer Fee (if you wish to transfer your holding to someone else): $500 + 2% of the total amount transferred, unless the buyer is identified by you in advance
